title: Youth club Green Brigades in Assam’s BTR on mission to ‘reclaim the climate’
content: Members of these brigades are re-greening urban landscapes and degraded forests with native timber species, fruit-bearing trees, and medicinal and flowering plants

title: He dedicates his life savings to honour photography’s pioneer
content: Retired Kerala State Electricity Board senior superintendent Saji Ennakkad plans to build a memorial for Joseph Nicéphore Niépce, the French inventor and pioneer of photography, at Vathikulam, near Mavelikara

title: Demand for Madanapalle district intensifies
content: Madanapalle, with a larger population, a strong intellectual society that took shape during the British Raj, and well established educational institutions, hospitals, and business avenues, makes it better suited to be a district headquarters say the residents

title: Watch: What the people of Manipur really think about PM Modi’s visit
content: Reporting from Churachandpur, Vijaita Singh highlights the sentiments of local residents following Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s announcement of infrastructure projects worth over ₹7,300 crore. The people of Churachandpur expressed hopes for enhanced connectivity, sustained peace, improved access to basic amenities, and justice for those displaced during the 2023 unrest.

title: Rain alert in Guntur: GMC steps up preventive measures
content: All GMC officials and ward secretariat staff have been instructed to remain on duty until the rains subside, with leaves cancelled

title: Webinar on brain, spine, and mind to be held on September 14
content: The panellists are Ennapadam S. Krishnamoorthy, behavioural neurologist and neuropsychiatrist, founder, Buddhi Clinic, and Vivek Misra, director, clinical neurosciences and neurotechnology, Buddhi Clinic

title: Watch: How stone quarrying and mining around the Aravalis is badly affecting people’s health
content: The Aravali mountains are India’s oldest range, stretching from Delhi to Gujarat, across about 650 km. With mines and crushers coming up next to villages in and around the Aravalis allegedly over the past 20 years or so, people complain of respiratory and skin diseases, and falling groundwater levels, affecting both the health of people and their farms

title: CPI(M) orders internal enquiry into mobile phone recording “implicating” Thrissur leadership of profiteering
content: Opposition UDF sought to exploit the controversy to put the ruling LDF on the defensive ahead of the Legislative Assembly session, which commences on September 15

title: AAP protests India-Pakistan cricket match, warns Delhi clubs against screening
content: According to the government’s new sports policy, India will not play bilateral contests against Pakistan but will continue to face them in multilateral tournaments such as the ongoing Asia Cup and ICC events

title: Accident during Ganesha procession: Among the dead, three are BE students at Mosale Hosahalli
content: The students joined the procession after having dinner at the hostel. They would have completed their BE degree in a couple of months. As many as 11 students suffered injuries in the incident.

title: Urbanisation drive in Kerala to shift towards northern districts in the next 30 years, says Urban Policy Commission Chairman
content: Kerala will be 87% urban by 2030. The State has around 350 census towns, which is the highest in India after Tamil Nadu

title: Kerala Cabinet approves draft Kerala Forest (Amendment) Bill, 2025
content: The draft Kerala Forest Amendment Bill, 2025, also has provisions for the sale of sandalwood trees on private land through the Forest Department outlets

title: Telangana | Senior Maoist leader Sujatha surrenders after 43 years underground
content: So far in 2025, 404 underground cadres have surrendered before the police, including four State Committee Members, one Divisional Committee Secretary, eight Divisional Committee Members and 34 Area Committee Members

title: Inspector among 11 police personnel suspended for their links with peddlers in Bengaluru
content: The police during the course of investigation, found that the accused were in regular touch with the Chamrajapete and JJ Nagar police

title: India-Pak cricket match insult to national sentiment, says Uddhav; Sena (UBT) to stage ‘sindoor’ protests
content: Uddhav Thackeray said boycotting the Asia Cup match between the two countries, scheduled for September 14, 2025, is an opportunity to convey to the world India's stance on terrorism

title: Economist and social activist Prasenjit Bose to join Congress
content: Prasenjit Bose said the biggest challenge before the people is to resist Special Intensive Revision so that the people’s right to vote is protected

title: New Delhi Declaration adopted to preserve, disseminate ‘vast treasure’ of manuscripts
content: The Declaration was adopted on the closing day of the three-day 'Gyan Bharatam' conference on India's manuscript heritage, hosted at the Vigyan Bhawan in New Delhi

title: MNS spokesperson Prakash Mahajan resigns from party, says ‘ignored despite least expectations’
content: Prakash Mahajan, the brother of former Union Minister and BJP leader late Pramod Mahajan, announced his decision in a video message, in which he also said that he never received praise for his work in the party

title: Dull picture, low contrast | What happened to the big screen experience in India?
content: Despite having over 9,000 screens, many of India’s movie theatres are far from achieving international standards. There’s plenty to blame, from outdated lamp projectors to exhibitors cutting costs

title: TVK rally: Heavy traffic as Vijay’s convoy crawls through Tiruchi
content: Mr. Vijay is yet to reach Marakkadai after four hours on the 8-km stretch; cadres and fans face water shortage as shops remain closed

title: PM Modi in Manipur: Want to make Manipur symbol of peace, prosperity, says Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the Centre's continuous efforts towards peace led to talks between the two warring sides

title: DMK is not a party that draws empty crowds lacking ideology, says T.N. CM Stalin
content: “Let us gather as an ideologically committed crowd and leave the venues as soldiers ready to fulfil our goals,” he said in his message on the eve of the party’s Mupperum Vizha to be held in Karur.

title: South African province to strike pact with Kerala government on climate-resilient infrastructure
content: KwaZulu-Natal, which includes the city of Durban, has been the hardest hit by climate change of all nine provinces in South Africa

title: Mangaluru court sentences 51 year-old man to death for murder, rape of minor girl
content: While Madara was sentenced to death for the offence of murder, life imprisonment was awarded for the offence of penetrative sexual assault. “Both the sentences should run concurrently,” the court said

title: PM Modi's Manipur visit 'tokenism', 'grave insult' to people of State: Congress
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge accused Modi of organising a grand welcome ceremony for himself and claimed that it "is a cruel prick" to the wounds of those still suffering

title: MP Ruhullah aghast over bureaucratic hurdles for Anantnag event
content: He said the officers of the district need to decide “if they were subservient to the Constitution or the dictations from Delhi”.

title: Election Commission, and no other authority, decides when to conduct SIR: ECI tells SC
content: A direction to conduct SIR at ‘regular intervals’ throughout the country would encroach the exclusive jurisdiction of the Election Commission

title: Kerala Speaker’s office receives letter stating Rahul Mamkootathil remains debarred from CLP
content: An official attached to the Speaker’s office said Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan’s missive was brief and did not attribute any reason for the decision

title: Ex-Aspiration CEO denies Kawhi had no-show deal
content: The former chief executive officer of Aspiration, the company that LA Clippers owner Steve Ballmer is accused of using to circumvent the salary cap, said Friday that claims that Kawhi Leonard signed a no-show contract with his former company are false.

title: Barça boss Flick slams Spain over Yamal injury
content: Barcelona boss Hansi Flick accused Spain of "not taking care" of Lamine Yamal during the international break after he was ruled out of Sunday's match.

title: Tigers ace Skubal exits start, to undergo imaging
content: Tigers star left-hander Tarik Skubal left the club's 8-2 loss to the Marlins in the fourth inning after experiencing tightness in his left side.

title: Hill: Focus is on football, not abuse allegations
content: Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill declined to comment on his divorce case, saying he is only focused on his job and providing for his family.

title: 49ers rule out QB Purdy; Jones to start vs. Saints
content: Mac Jones will start against the Saints on Sunday after San Francisco 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan officially announced that Brock Purdy will not play in New Orleans.

title: Sources: ACC ref, irked by replay handling, quits
content: Gary Patterson, frustrated by the handling of a replay review during the UConn-Syracuse game last week, abruptly terminated his contract with the conference after the contest, sources told ESPN.

title: GM: Sky keeping Reese despite late-season strife
content: Chicago Sky general manager Jeff Pagliocca said Friday that he expects star Angel Reese to remain a member of the team despite late-season friction between the two sides.

title: Fore! Daly shoots a record-high 19 on way to 88
content: John Daly is in the PGA Tour Champions record book for the highest score on a hole. He made a 19 in the first round of the Sanford International.

title: 🍼 J.J. McCarthy and fiancée announce son's birth
content: The Minnesota Vikings quarterback left the team on Thursday to be with his fiancée ahead of their son's birth.

title: Who should be panicking already? Connelly's crisis tiers for Week 3
content: The levels of anxiety at some powers are rising. We put these teams into tiers and look at how Week 3's games could change things.

title: Ready for Sunday? We have last-minute Week 2 sleepers, surprises, trends to watch and more
content: Can J.J. McCarthy find ways to beat Jessie Bates? Does Juwan Johnson have fantasy appeal? And could James Conner have a big rushing day?

title: How Terence Crawford landed Canelo Alvarez
content: Terence Crawford wanted the fight he wasn't supposed to win. He gets that opportunity Saturday after a yearslong chase.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Will Silva end the Fighting Nerds' losing streak at Noche UFC?
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the Noche UFC main event between Diego Lopes and Jean Silva. Ian Parker gives his value picks for the card.

title: Colleges: Can USF score enough to stay with Miami?
content: South Florida has moved up to No. 18 after two upset victories to start the season, but a road game at No. 5 Miami is by far the biggest test to date.

title: WNBA playoff preview: Stars, matchups and X factors that could decide the champion
content: We break down all eight teams in the WNBA postseason, from their best assets to potential fatal flaws.

title: Ranking the 25 best players in the WNBA playoffs
content: From MVP front-runners to the Sixth Player of the Year favorite, here are the best players in the postseason.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 2
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Charbonnet becomes RB2, Johnston is most dropped
content: Zach Charbonnet to usurp Kenneth Walker III? Quentin Johnston a mirage? Raiders pass game underrated?

title: What's it like to catch a TD from both Rodgers and Favre?
content: The Steelers passer is one touchdown from tying the Packers legend at No. 4 in career passing TDs. One player opens up about both QBs.

title: Before Joe Flacco was the Browns QB, he was Baltimore's 'Joe Cool'
content: From the Ravens to the Browns, we have stories of how the QB is "ice cold when it comes to clutch situations."

title: 🏈 Ranking NFL QB debuts from Fields to Rodgers
content: Can Justin Fields and Aaron Rodgers sustain their great Week 1 play? Ben Solak stacks the top QB newcomers -- and begs the Giants to hold off on Jaxson Dart.

title: 🤯 Inside Rob Ryan's most surprising move yet
content: Even though Rob Ryan hasn't coached college football in over 25 years, he has already acclimated to life in L.A.

title: ⚾ Why each MLB contender can win the World Series
content: Lack of power? Bullpen holes? Injured stars? Why each contender's biggest weakness will -- or won't -- sink them in October.

title: 🔥 Which CFB coaches are on the hot seat?
content: Who could be on the hot seat? Who are coaching candidates to watch? Our experts explain the current coaching landscape.

title: 🏀 Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clips partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: ↔️ Jags trade RB Bigsby to Eagles for draft picks
content: The Jaguars have traded running back Tank Bigsby to the Eagles for 2026 fifth- and sixth-round picks.

title: How much will Kyle Tucker and Kyle Schwarber get paid this winter? MLB insiders predict their free agency
content: Industry insiders break down the two top hitters in the free agent class as they complete very different regular seasons.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Serie A clubs queue up for Zirkzee
content: Juventus are leading the Serie A clubs vying to bring in Joshua Zirkzee from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: USMNT 2026 World Cup Big Board 2.0: Balogun, Zendejas on the rise
content: With nine months until the World Cup begins, which U.S. players are best positioned to make the squad after a turbulent September window?

title: Derby of keeper dilemmas: Man United, Man City both searching for answers in goal
content: Manchester City and Manchester United share more than just a city this season. Will Sunday's derby offer clarity for either club at goalkeeper?

title: The worst Manchester derby ever is upon on us. How did we get here?
content: United have struggled for years, while City have declined recently. Sunday's  derby might be the rivalry's low point.

title: Let's break down every NBA team's biggest roster hole: What must each team fix?
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton breaks down the most important issues facing each NBA team before the start of the season.

title: Nine innings, 99 nuggets: Joey Chestnut taking on new challenge at Dodgers-Giants
content: The competitive eating legend is going to be joined at the Glove by a contest-winning fan who will compete with him.

title: From Kamara to Chubb: Last time Tennessee beat Georgia
content: Volunteers quarterback Josh Dobbs found wide receiver Jauan Jennings for a miraculous Hail Mary -- in 2016.

title: Arizona's throwback helmets and Oregon's colorful combo lead top Week 3 college football uniforms
content: The Tennessee Volunteers are sticking with their classically excellent combination of orange and white for a major SEC showdown with the Georgia Bulldogs.

title: Who wins the PLL championship? Key stats, matchups, X factors
content: The top two teams are set to clash on Sunday, with a title on the line. Here's everything you need to know.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: TVK Vijay rally LIVE: Has DMK fulfilled all its 2021 poll promises, asks Vijay
content: After two State conferences — at Vikravandi and Madurai — Mr. Vijay is now hitting the road, projecting himself as a gamechanger in the 2026 elections

title: Security vigil heightened in J&K in wake of Hazratbal controversy and tense Doda situation
content: J&K Director General of Police (DGP) Nalin Prabhat also directed district police heads in the Union Territory “to closely monitor social media platforms to prevent the spread of misinformation that could jeopardise public safety and order”.

title: Chennai-based Unico Housing Finance raises ₹120 crore
content: Unico is a fast-growing housing finance company offering a wide range of products, including home construction loans, home purchase loans, and home improvement loans, among others

title: Heavy rainfall in Himachal village; several vehicles buried in debris, farms damaged
content: About 953 power transformers and 336 water supply schemes have been disrupted in the State due to the recent floods and landslides, according to the State Emergency Operation Centre (SEOC)

title: Rahul Gandhi, Uttar Pradesh Minister engage in heated exchange during meeting in Raebareli
content: The incident occurred during the District Development Coordination and Monitoring Committee meeting held at the Collectorate's Bachat Bhawan

title: Hyderabad drug bust: Accused linked to international drug network spanning eight years
content: Maharashtra police continues to grill the owner of Vagdevi Laboratories Pvt Ltd, Srinivas Vijay Voleti; more arrests likely to follow

title: Case registered over bomb threat email to Bombay HC
content: The High Court administration received a bomb threat email on Friday, September 12, afternoon, which led to the suspension of hearings for nearly two hours.

title: Truck driver booked for ‘rash driving’ after ploughing into crowd during Ganesha procession in Karnataka’s Hassan
content: The driver also suffered injuries in the incident. The police booked the case based on the statement by Manjunath of Danayakanahalli, who lost his nephew Eshwar in the incident

title: ‘Green Girl’ interview: Sarthak Hegde and team on their interfaith romance drama
content: The makers of ‘Green Girl’, director Sarthak Hegde and actors Mayur Gowda and Suchaitha Haritas, talk to The Hindu about their inter-faith relationship drama.

title: Northeast suffered heavily due to ‘vote bank’ politics, now country’s growth engine, says PM Modi
content: The direct rail connectivity between Mizoram and the rest of the country will offer the people of the region safe, efficient, and cost-effective travel options

title: Watch: Mizoram’s first railway in over 75 years: What you need to know
content: Mizoram is now connected to India’s railway network with its first-ever train. The Bairabi–Sairang railway line, spanning 51.38 km, links Aizawl to Silchar in Assam, cutting travel time from ten hours by road to just three hours by train. Built at a cost of ₹5,021 crore, the project features 48 tunnels, 55 major bridges, and the iconic Bridge No. 144, taller than the Qutub Minar.

title: Durga Puja artists of Kumartuli worried over crackdown on thermocol use and looming deadlines
content: Artists and idol makers say they lack the resources to replace thermocol with affordable alternatives

title: Actor and TVK chief Vijay embarks on State-wide tour in Tiruchi
content: The police granted permission for the meeting with a set of 23 conditions, drawing sharp criticism from the actor. Fans and party cadre start pouring in

title: PM Modi LIVE: PM arrives in Guwahati on a two-day visit to Assam
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate and lay the foundation stones for various projects worth over ₹19,000 crore in Assam.

title: Acquitted 7/11 blasts accused seeks ₹9 crore compensation for nine years in jail
content: Wahid Deen Mohammad Shaikh seeks ₹9 crore for nine years of wrongful imprisonment and custodial torture.

title: Push back involves serious issues pertaining to life and liberty of a person, says Calcutta HC
content: Sunali Bibi a resident of Paikar in Birbhum, her husband Danish, and their eight-year-old son were pushed into Bangladesh on June 26 after being detained by the Delhi Police. Sunali is eight months pregnant

title: 20 custodial deaths in two years in Rajasthan; rights groups express concern
content: Civil rights groups in the State have expressed concern over the custodial deaths and demanded judicial inquiry into each of them and transparent investigation into the cases classified as suicides or medical causes, in order to ensure accountability.

title: India votes in favour of UNGA resolution on Palestine endorsing two-state solution
content: The resolution, introduced by France, was adopted with an overwhelming 142 nations voting in favour, 10 against and 12 abstentions

title: CPI(M) calls for intensified struggles against corporate exploitation
content: Instead of burdening people with higher taxes, the government must provide better facilities, says Raghavulu

title: Myanmar Army Commander Visits Eastern Command, Defence Ties Strengthened
content: India has consistently extended assistance to Myanmar in modernising its defence infrastructure, with both nations promoting technology-driven collaboration

title: Mobile network outage affects lakhs as Hyderabad’s cable clean-up drive intensifies
content: Residents struggling to make phone calls or use cellular data after fibre-optic lines powering 5G towers were cut

title: Former Election Commissioner Ashok Lavasa to speak at Manthan on September 12
content: The theme of the event will be the current EC role that is debated in Parliament and is now, a subject of SC litigation

title: Chandrababu Naidu, Pawan Kalyan congratulate C.P. Radhakrishnan on being sworn in as Vice-President
content: Pawan Kalyan conveyed his appreciation to President Droupadi Murmu for gracing the ceremony with her presence, calling it a moment of national pride

title: After the disaster: Punjab flood victims face displacement and livelihood loss
content: Punjab’s floods have taken 55 lives and left thousands of people homeless. Vikas Vasudeva reports on the anxiety around the loss of farm produce and jobs. People in relief camps wonder when they can return home and worry about the condition of their houses and belongings collected over years of work and struggle

title: Shiv Sena UBT, MNS hold joint rally in Nashik, leaders say Maharashtra will now stand by the Thackerays
content: Sanjay Raut alleged that the brutal murder of Rahul Dhotre was orchestrated by workers of Devendra Fadnavis and Girish Mahajan

title: Maharashtra onion farmers launch seven-day ‘phone strike’ over crashing prices
content: Onion farmers directly called ministers and elected representatives to press for urgent relief and fair rates.

title: Ending India’s Russian oil imports is top priority, says U.S. envoy-designate Sergio Gor
content: Trade deal only once India ends Russian oil imports, says U.S. Commerce Secretary; India, U.S. are “not that far apart” on a deal, will be resolved in a few weeks, says Mr. Gor, emphasises Modi-Trump friendship

title: Imposing tariffs for Russian oil purchases ‘causes a rift with India’, says Trump
content: Mr. Trump also repeated his claim that he has solved seven conflicts so far in his second term as President

title: BCCI is anti-national, says Shiv Sena (UBT)
content: If blood and water can’t flow together, how can blood and cricket go together, asks Aaditya Thackeray

title: Over 150 drug cases registered in a day in Ernakulam range
content: Operation conducted in Ernakulam (Rural), Alappuzha, Kottayam and Idukki districts; suspected addictive substances seized; punitive action taken against 182 people for alleged sale and consumption of banned tobacco products

title: Madras High Court orders T.N. government to create buffer zone along 320-km long boundary between forests and human habitations in Coimbatore
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy say humans can develop elsewhere but the flora and fauna cannot survive anywhere but for the forests

title: INS Aravali Commissioned as Navy’s new nerve centre in Gurugram
content: Named after the steadfast Aravali Range, the base will support command, control and Maritime Domain Awareness (MDA) operations

title: Watch: For the first time, Chennai builds elevated corridor above metro tunnels
content: For the first time, Chennai is constructing an elevated four-lane corridor directly above underground Metro tunnels between Teynampet and Saidapet, ensuring the twin tunnels remain completely safe.

title: Motorist dies after SUV laden with red sanders hits him
content: Police searched the vehicle and found 15 wooden logs of red sanders that weighed over 500 kg and worth around ₹ 20 lakh.

title: Watch: Ground report: Manipur prepares for PM Modi’s visit amid ethnic crisis
content: The visit comes over two years after deadly ethnic violence between Kuki and Meitei communities left over 260 dead and thousands homeless. The Hindu Deputy Editor Vijaita Singh reports on the ongoing situation and the political context surrounding Modi’s visit.

title: AIADMK alleges discrepancies in elector database of Chepauk-Thiruvallikeni Assembly constituency
content: The party found 1,722 electors, whose names figured in the electoral rolls, were not ‘physically present’ at the mentioned addresses

title: A new railway line to redefine the Northeast
content: The 51.38-kilometre railway line linking Bairabi station to the newly built Sairang station near to Mizoram’s capital Aizawl will mark a major milestone for the Northeast Frontier Railway and also signals the Indian government’s broader plan to extend railway connectivity all the way to the Myanmar border

title: Supreme Court asks Seeman to apologise to woman or face dismissal of his petition to quash criminal proceedings
content: The court extends the interim stay on the investigation against the NTK chief coordinator till the next date of hearing

title: Kerala government to release GCC policy shortly
content: Government intends to offer incentives to encourage companies that wish to start global capability centres in State, says CM

title: Supreme Court agrees to hear plea alleging minor’s sexual assault, custodial torture by Gujarat police
content: The plea has sought the setting up of a Special Investigation Team excluding Gujarat cadre officers or a court-monitored CBI probe

title: 'Connected by shared history': PM Modi's message to Nepal; lauds Sushila Karki
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his visit to Manipur, extended congratulations to Sushila Karki on becoming Nepal's first woman Prime Minister, reaffirming India's strong ties with Nepal. He lauded Nepal's democratic values and the resilience of its people. Modi also addressed the Manipur crisis, assuring support and urging peace for progress in the region.

title: 'Just say when': Donald Trump pleads Nato nations to sanction Russia
content: Donald Trump stated his willingness to impose significant sanctions on Russia, contingent on all NATO nations ceasing Russian oil imports and implementing similar measures. He criticized some NATO members for continuing energy purchases from Russia, deeming it detrimental to the alliance's negotiating strength. Trump also suggested imposing substantial tariffs on China until the Ukraine war concludes.

title: ‘Image must change’: Tharoor says India seen unsafe for women; flags tourism inequality
content: Shashi Tharoor urges India to prioritize women's safety for tourism growth. He highlights tourism's potential to combat unemployment and generate revenue. Tharoor criticizes the lack of mid-range tourist facilities. He emphasizes the need for more hotels and improved infrastructure. He notes that India attracts fewer tourists than smaller destinations. Tharoor calls for giving tourism greater priority.

title: Asia Cup: Shoaib Akhtar's brutal India vs Pakistan prediction - 'Hammer you down'
content: India and Pakistan are set to clash in a highly anticipated Asia Cup match in Dubai, following dominant wins in their opening games. Shoaib Akhtar predicts India will aim to dominate Pakistan, emphasizing the need for Pakistan to perform at their peak. The match promises to be an exciting chapter in the storied rivalry.

title: Nano Banana trend: Turn photos into 3D figurines with Google AI Studio; 15 easy prompts
content: Google's new AI image editor, "Nano Banana," integrated into the Gemini app, allows users to effortlessly transform photos into 3D models. This tool, officially known as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, has seen widespread adoption, with over 200 million images created or modified. Users can easily generate 3D figurines, designer pet toys, and fantasy avatars using simple text prompts.

title: Pune techie attacked with billhook outside Vimannagar; accused arrested
content: In Pune, a 33-year-old IT professional was brutally attacked with a billhook outside his fiancée's workplace in Vimannagar. Two men, later arrested, assaulted him due to mistaken identity, fueled by a cab driver's suspicion of a love affair. The victim sustained severe injuries, prompting calls for increased security and patrolling in the area, highlighting rising concerns about criminal activities.

title: ITR filing: Over 6 cr returns submitted so far; Sept 15 deadline looms for taxpayers
content: The Income Tax Department announced it has received over six crore income tax returns for the Assessment Year 2025-26. The deadline for filing without penalty is September 15th. The department's helpdesk is available 24/7 to assist taxpayers. An extension was granted due to revisions in ITR forms. ITR submissions have been steadily increasing, with a record 7.

title: AI job cuts: Elon Musk’s xAI asks Grok trainers to exit; what internal memo said
content: Elon Musk's xAI has reportedly laid off at least 500 data annotators, impacting its Grok AI training. The company cited a strategic shift towards specialist AI tutors, planning a tenfold increase in that area. Affected employees, generalist AI tutors, were notified via email and had their system access terminated immediately.

title: IND vs PAK | 'Big match, but not for Pakistan': Saim Ayub makes massive claim
content: Saim Ayub downplays the hype surrounding the upcoming Asia Cup clash between Pakistan and India, emphasizing the team's focus on the present and their goal of winning the tournament. Despite recent struggles with his personal form, Ayub expresses confidence in the team's support and highlights the importance of adapting to the pitch conditions in Dubai.

title: Hyderabad murder: Man who repeatedly struck Renuka with pressure cooker arrested
content: Hyderabad police have apprehended Harsh and Roushan in Ranchi for the brutal murder of 50-year-old Renuka Agarwal at her Kukatpally flat. The attackers, who repeatedly assaulted Agarwal with a pressure cooker and stabbed her, sought access to valuables. After the murder, they stole gold and cash, changed clothes, and fled, but were traced via CCTV footage and a manpower agent.

title: 'Left no choice': Amazon suspends engineer; sent 'threatening' letter to CEO
content: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: 'Will watch in burqa’: Nitesh Rane mocks Aaditya over India–Pakistan match
content: Maharashtra Minister Nitesh Rane mocked Aaditya Thackeray, suggesting he'd secretly watch the India-Pakistan cricket match in disguise. This jab followed Thackeray's criticism of the BJP for allowing the match despite Pakistan's history of terrorism.

title: ‘RPM was high’: Woman describes moment Thar flew out of Delhi showroom
content: A woman testing a Mahindra Thar in a Delhi showroom accidentally accelerated, crashing through a glass wall and plunging 15 feet. Despite the dramatic accident, the woman, her husband, and a showroom employee escaped with only minor injuries. The woman has since refuted rumors of serious injury or death, attributing the incident to high RPM.

title: Asia Cup: Tit-for-tat! After IPL franchise, now PSL team boycotts IND vs PAK
content: Ahead of the highly anticipated India-Pakistan Asia Cup 2025 clash, off-field controversies have erupted. PSL franchise Karachi Kings mirrored IPL's Punjab Kings' veiled reference to Pakistan, sparking online backlash. An Indian Supreme Court plea sought to cancel the match, citing terrorism concerns and national security, but was denied an urgent hearing.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: Arjun Tendulkar pays tribute; posts Instagram story
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot during a campus tour stop at Utah Valley University, sparking widespread grief. The incident occurred shortly after a question about mass shootings by transgender individuals. Indian cricketer Arjun Tendulkar, among others, shared condolences, highlighting Kirk's global influence. Tendulkar's message reflects the shock following Kirk's murder.

title: ‘8-10 rounds were fired’: Disha Patani’s father Jagdish Patani reacts to home attack
content: Gunshots were fired at actress Disha Patani's family home in Bareilly, with her father, Jagdish Patani, confirming the use of foreign-made weapons. The Goldy Brar group claimed responsibility, citing alleged disrespect towards religious figures. Police have launched an investigation, registered an FIR, and increased security for the Patani family, with multiple teams working to apprehend the assailants.

title: Delhi riots case: Amnesty, 6 other global rights' bodies seek Umar Khalid's release
content: Amnesty International and other human rights organizations are urging the Indian government to release Umar Khalid, a former JNU student, highlighting his prolonged detention as a symbol of repression against those exercising free expression. They criticize the selective prosecution of activists opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Act while officials allegedly inciting communal tensions enjoy impunity.

title: Ranji Trophy: Big Blow for Kerala! Cricketer joins Maharashtra before new season
content: Jalaj Saxena, a seasoned all-rounder, has signed with Maharashtra for the Ranji Trophy 2025-26 season, leaving Kerala after nine years. The Maharashtra Cricket Association welcomes Saxena, highlighting his experience and mentoring abilities. Alongside Prithvi Shaw, Saxena aims to bolster the team's performance, bringing his impressive domestic record and IPL experience to Maharashtra.

title: 4 years' jail for AAP MLA in Dalit woman assault case
content: In a 12-year-old case, AAP MLA Manjinder Singh Lalpura from Khadoor Sahib has been sentenced to four years in prison for assault and molestation of a Dalit woman. An additional sessions judge convicted eleven individuals, including six policemen. Lalpura and six others received four-year terms, while three got one-year sentences.

title: India ramps up fight against dengue, malaria; health ministry issues directives
content: Due to heavy rains and floods, the Union Health Ministry has alerted states about dengue and malaria. Health Minister Shri Jagat Prakash Nadda wants states to act fast and send plans in 20 days. Local bodies should educate people. Hospitals must have enough medicine and beds. India has greatly reduced malaria cases.

title: Dhruv Rathee slams Vivek Agnihotri, calls kids watching The Bengal Files a crime
content: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files' is embroiled in controversy after YouTuber Dhruv Rathee criticized the filmmaker for allegedly showing the adult-rated film to children. Rathee expressed concern over the potential trauma caused by the film's violence and gore. The film, part of Agnihotri's 'files' trilogy, explores the events surrounding Direct Action Day in 1946 and has garnered mixed reviews.

title: 'New dawn for Manipur': PM Modi urges peace 'to secure children's future' – top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi made his first visit to Manipur since the ethnic violence began, braving heavy rain to reach Churachandpur. He laid foundation stones for development projects worth ₹7,300 crore and inaugurated projects worth ₹1,200 crore. Modi emphasized Manipur's significance in the Northeast's growth, highlighting improved connectivity and infrastructure projects.

title: Airstrike on two Myanmar schools as students slept; 19 killed
content: Airstrike in Myanmar's Rakhine state killed at least 19 high school students. Twenty-two others sustained injuries. The Arakan Army reported the incident occurred in Kyauktaw township. The AA blamed the ruling military junta for the attack on private schools. UNICEF condemned the brutal attack. The strike adds to escalating violence in Rakhine.

title: UP horror: Student raped by auto driver on Yamuna E-way; accused shot in encounter
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly sexually assaulted by an autorickshaw driver in Mathura after she hired him from the Yamuna Expressway to reach her university. The driver deviated from the route, stopped at a deserted location, and assaulted her.

title: ‘Burnt alive over dowry’: Victim’s last words convict in-laws; UP court gives them life term
content: An Aligarh court sentenced five family members to life imprisonment for the dowry death of Neelam Bharti, who was harassed for more dowry even after her family spent Rs 20 lakh on the wedding. Before dying from being set ablaze, Neelam identified her husband, in-laws, and sister-in-law as her murderers in a dying declaration.

title: Jaguars vs FanDuel: $5M payout revealed; ex-worker scandal rocks NFL
content: Amit Patel, a former Jacksonville Jaguars finance manager, embezzled approximately $22 million from the team between 2019 and 2023, primarily using the funds for gambling on FanDuel. Following Patel's guilty plea and prison sentence, FanDuel agreed to pay the Jaguars $5 million as a partial settlement. Patel also sued FanDuel, alleging exploitation of his gambling addiction.

title: ‘Demanded job again’: Fired worker stabs Hyderabad bizman to death in full public view
content: In Hyderabad, real estate businessman Srikanth Reddy was fatally stabbed in Moulali's HB Colony on Friday. The primary suspect, Dhanraj, a former employee fired for intoxication, repeatedly sought re-employment. After receiving money for liquor, Dhanraj, along with an accomplice Daniel, returned and attacked Srikanth when his job request was denied.

title: 'Post war': Ex-Pakistan seamer reminds high stakes in India vs Pakistan match
content: The highly anticipated India-Pakistan Asia Cup 2025 clash is set for September 14 in Dubai, amidst political tensions and initial ticket sale concerns. Shoaib Akhtar dismisses unsold ticket rumors, anticipating a packed stadium due to heightened emotions. Both teams began their campaigns strongly, with Pakistan defeating Oman convincingly and India dominating UAE.

title: Shots fired outside Disha Patani's Bareilly house; Goldy Brar group claims responsibility
content: In Bareilly, unidentified assailants fired shots at Disha Patani's residence, with the Goldy Brar group, linked to Lawrence Bishnoi, claiming responsibility. The attack is suspected to be connected to a controversy involving Disha's sister, Khushboo Patani, who criticized Aniruddh Acharya for alleged misogynistic remarks. Khushboo's online video expressing her anger may have triggered the incident.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistan skipper warns India - 'we are good enough...'
content: Pakistan's captain, Salman Agha, exuded confidence in his team's ability to triumph over any opponent, including India, after their dominant 93-run victory against Oman in Dubai. This statement precedes the highly anticipated India-Pakistan clash in the Asia Cup. Agha acknowledged areas for improvement in batting but praised the outstanding bowling performance.

title: Oracle’s stock rally mints new millionaires; young techies in India reap windfalls too
content: Oracle's stock surged by 36% following multi-billion-dollar AI cloud deals, briefly making Larry Ellison the world's richest person. This rally minted hundreds of new millionaires among Oracle staff, thanks to restricted stock units. An engineer in Bengaluru now values his portfolio at Rs 1.5 crore.

title: Want to go to UAE? Don’t skip the certificate of equivalency - Here's how to apply
content: Moving to the UAE for work, study, or residency? You'll need a Certificate of Equivalency to validate your foreign degree. Issued by the Ministry of Higher Education, this document proves your qualification meets UAE standards. The process includes attestation, verification, ICA travel records, and an online application. It’s essential for jobs, university admissions, and Golden Visa eligibility.

title: Ilia Topuria: McGregor-style ambition to political tease; “President Ilia” leaves fans buzzing
content: Ilia Topuria, the current UFC lightweight champion, has addressed the possibility of entering politics, similar to Conor McGregor. While he hasn't seriously considered it, Topuria stated he wouldn't rule it out if the public desired his leadership. He also expressed confidence in defeating McGregor in his prime, highlighting the evolution of the sport.

title: Prominent figure in cricket under investigation for drink spiking, sexual assault
content: A well-known English cricket personality in his 40s is being investigated by Scotland Yard following allegations of drink spiking and sexual assault against two women in a Fulham pub in May. The Metropolitan Police interviewed the man under caution in June, but no arrests have been made.

title: Travis Kelce & Taylor Swift: Engagement buzz to fan backlash; Gaylor community divided
content: Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce has stirred a whirlwind of reactions, particularly among the 'Gaylor' fanbase, who believe Swift's public image conceals her true identity. Kelce's role has become central to discussions, with some fans questioning the authenticity of the relationship. While some express disappointment, others adopt a more nuanced perspective, acknowledging the complexities of identity and relationships.

title: 'Oppose this’: Pahalgam victim’s father reacts ahead of Ind-Pak Asia cup
content: Sanjay Dwivedi, grieving the loss of his son in the Pahalgam terror attack, is strongly against the India-Pakistan cricket match in the T20 Asia Cup. He reminded the government of their promise to cut ties after the April attack that killed 26, urging them to respect public sentiment and reconsider sports relations with Pakistan.

title: Pak military convoy attacked: Taliban ambush kills 12 soldiers in Waziristan
content: A Pakistani Taliban ambush in South Waziristan resulted in the deaths of at least 12 soldiers, marking one of the deadliest attacks in recent months. The Tehreek-e-Taliban (TTP) claimed responsibility, highlighting the intensified militant activities in the Afghanistan-Pakistan border regions since 2021.

title: Mizoram's first railway line: PM Modi inaugurates Bairabi–Sairang project
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Mizoram's first railway line, the Bairabi–Sairang broad-gauge project, a significant boost to the state's connectivity. The project, costing Rs 8,070 crore, features complex engineering, including numerous tunnels and bridges. This new line directly links Aizawl with the Indian railway network, enhancing logistics, tourism, and daily life for residents.

title: India backs UN resolution; votes for 'sovereign Palestinian state'
content: India supported a UN resolution backing the 'New York Declaration,' advocating for a peaceful resolution to the Palestine issue through a two-state solution. The resolution, adopted with 142 votes, urges collective action to end the Gaza conflict and calls on Israel to commit to a two-state solution, halt settlement activities, and end violence against Palestinians.

title: Manipur Violence Victims, Locals Break Down While Interacting With PM Modi
content: Emotions ran high as the victims of ethnic violence met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Manipur's Churachandpur this afternoon.

title: "I'm Alive, Not Dead": Woman Who Flew Thar Out Of Delhi Showroom's 1st Floor
content: The accident reportedly took place when Maani Pawar was performing a customary ritual inside the showroom before taking it out on the road.

title: 'Historic Day For Mizoram As State Enters Country's Railway Map': Chief Minister Lalduhoma
content: Chief Minister Lalduhoma on Saturday said it was a historic day as the state entered the country's railway map, which will have a far-reaching impact as it bridges the dreams and reality between the state and Bharat.

title: 'Compensation Doesn't Equate Value Of Lives Lost': Siddaramaiah On Hassan Accident
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday said the government gives a compensation of Rs 5 lakh to the family of each victim in the Hassan accident to express condolence, not in a bid to equate the value of human life with the compensation.

title: "We Have To Take Manipur Forward On Path Of Peace": PM Modi In Imphal
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi peppered his speech in Manipur's Imphal, his first visit to the violence-hit state in two years, with development, listing out his government's various initiatives in the state.

title: PM Modi In Manipur LIVE Updates | 21st Century Belongs To North-East, Says PM In Imphal, In Big Message After 2023 Unrest
content: PM Narendra Modi Manipur Visit LIVE Updates: The Centre seeks to make Manipur a symbol of peace and prosperity, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Saturday, as made his first visit to the state since ethnic violence broke out two years ago.

title: 2 Men, Woman Tied To Electric Pole In Odisha, Thrashed Over Suspected Affair
content: Suspecting an affair, villagers in Odisha tied two men and a woman to an electric pole and thrashed them, even hitting them with sticks.

title: Woman, 12-Year-Old Son Die After Falling From 13th Floor Of Building In Noida: Cops
content: A 12-year-old child and his mother died on Saturday after falling from the 13th floor of a building in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar, police said.

title: Colombian Court Backs Porn Actress Esperanza Gomez In Meta Nudity Case
content: Colombia's Constitutional Court on Friday ordered Meta to change its privacy policies after ruling that it trampled the freedom of expression of a porn actress by closing her Instagram account.

title: BJP, AAP Face Off, Exchange Lists Of "Terrorist Members"
content: The BJP and the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) are caught in a war of words and exchange of list of "terrorists", who are members of each other's parties in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Maoist Leader Kishenji's Wife, Carrying Rs 1 Crore Reward, Surrenders In Telangana
content: In a major development in the fight against Maoists, a senior leader and wife of Maoist commander Kishenji - who was killed in 2011 - has surrendered before the Telangana Police.

title: High Political Pitch, Boycott Calls Ahead Of India vs Pak Asia Cup Face-Off
content: The India vs Pakistan fixture in the Asia Cup tomorrow has yet again raised the political temperature in the country.

title: No Helicopter Travel Due To Rain In Manipur. PM Modi Took Car To Churachandpur
content: It was raining heavily as Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Manipur's Imphal Saturday, his first visit to the state since ethnic violence broke out in 2023.

title: When Sushila Karki Was Almost Sacked As Nepal Chief Justice By Former PM
content: In 2017, Sushila Karki, then the Chief Justice, faced an impeachment attempt by former PM Prachanda and MPs after overruling a police appointment.

title: "Vice-Chancellor Accused Of Sexual Harassment May Be Forgiven But...": Top Court
content: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a sexual harassment case against West Bengal National University of Juridical Sciences Vice-Chancellor Nirmal Kanti Chakrabarti but directed that the judgment, which carries details of his alleged misconduct.

title: Indian-Origin Man Gets Life Term For Killing Mother In UK Over TV Remote
content: A 39-year-old Indian-origin man who killed his mother at her home in Birmingham has been sentenced to life imprisonment with a minimum term of 15 years behind bars before being considered for parole.

title: "Go Back To Your Country": Sikh Woman Raped, Faced Racist Abuse In UK
content: A Sikh woman in her twenties was raped by two men and was subjected to racist remarks in the UK's Oldbury town.

title: Actor Vijay Begins Mega Statewide Campaign For 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly Polls
content: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam founder, actor-politician Vijay was accorded a rousing reception here on Saturday by his party workers and admirers just before the start of his campaign for the 2026 Assembly election.

title: Fantasy baseball news: Tarik Skubal exits start early with tightness in side
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the first of six matinees is at Wrigley Field with the Chicago Cubs hosting the Tampa Bay Rays . ace Tarik Skubal leaves friday with an apparent injury .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the 2025 WNBA playoffs open Sunday . all eight teams are in action, with the no. 1 seed Minnesota Lynx taking on the expansion franchise Golden State Valkyries . the red-hot Las Vegas Aces host the Seattle Storm .

title: Wetzel: NCAA announcement shows athletes can't win at the sports betting game
content: Fresno State men's basketball was a team going nowhere, smack-dab in the middle of a dreadful 6-26 season in 2024-25 . they were set to host new Mexico on new year's Eve as heavy underdogs, up to 17.5 points . weaver's apparent belief that no one would notice when he placed a $50 daily fantasy bet on himself .

content: new york Yankees superstar Aaron Judge has hit more home runs since his debut . he is putting the finishing touches on his fourth season with at least 40 home runs and his fourth straight with an OPS over 1.000 while entering the final weeks with the American League MVP award within his reach . judge is ranked at 6-foot-7, 282 pounds .
